quotes: So now I help women returning home from prison and hopefully in three months I have my own house.
I hear that somebody's coming home.
explanation: The practice of advocating for ex-prisoners requires one to help others without expecting anything in return, as indicated by these quotes.

quotes: I have another program called Free Donors Receive Education and Employment...
We do mock interviews because at the interview, they're gonna look at your resume and see there's a gap in your resume and you have to explain that gap in your resume.
explanation: Making resources available that support growth, such as education and employment opportunities, leads to supporting post-prison reintegration.

quotes: When they did the redistricting that tore us all up, they moved the lines all over the place.
Washington, DC you can vote while you still in, in prison. So I wanted to try to get that policy, like how can we change that rule?
explanation: Promoting fair legislation supports the wider principle of justice system fairness, as suggested by these quotes.

quotes: When you go, I was used to going in and ask for an application, but they say you had to do it online.
...partner with an online college that does IT work so anybody's in the IT world.
That's something you do online as far as work.
explanation: Supporting technological literacy can be seen as a similar principle to providing available resources for growth as both aid in individual development, according to these quotes.

quotes: I've been voting since I got out.
Just because you got it, that don't mean you can't vote.
What's happening in your neighborhood? Why don't you start there voting on that.
explanation: Encouraging voting supports the wider principle of justice system fairness, as it empowers individuals to participate in the democratic process, as these quotes suggest.

quotes: They said I was a felon, so I tried to apply for the housing program, may have, and they also said I couldn't get out 'cause I was a felon.
The two and few, the two, the, the, the two and few dollars at like McDonald's and stuff, that wasn't gonna help me.
explanation: Changing hiring practices requires ensuring fair wages, as these quotes imply the interconnectedness of accessible employment and wage equity.
